problem_summary_simple: Find ways to select students so selected/unselected students are happy based on their preference numbers.
problem_summary_technical: Count valid group sizes by checking conditions against sorted student preferences or frequency counts.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by iterating through all possible group sizes (0 to n).
For each group size `i`, check if it satisfies the happiness conditions for all students.
A frequency array or sorting helps efficiently check these conditions.
Sorting the `nums` array allows for a greedy approach.
Iterate through possible group sizes `i` (0 to n).
Check if `nums[i-1] < i` (for selected students) and `nums[i] > i` (for unselected students).
